Description: Miniature Rhodian-type transport amphora; wheel-made; lower body is conical ending in a pointed base; carinated shoulder with a tall, concave neck; everted rim; the two vertical handles from shoulder to below rim, terminals pinched; made of buff clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: See D. Bailey, Op. Athn VI (1965), 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
